answers.answer: I'm not a doctor but just wanted to pass on some information that may help.  Your doctor acted correctly by doing the ultrasound as a precaution but it probably would be a good idea to have your blood tested for tumor markers also.  The thing with testicular cancer and blood markers is that not all guys diagnosed with tc present with elevated markers.  Some do others dont.  My boyfriend was one of the ones who didn't show elevated levels but still had the disease. This may be your doctors thinking but its such an easy test to run it seems silly that it wasn't.    Elevated markers means somethings up, no elevated markers means theres still a chance of having tc.  If your markers were above normal the sooner the mass comes out the better.  I dont want to worry you because it could be nothing but three months when it could be something is a long time in terms of cancer.  Keep checking any changes in size and act quickly if it gets larger.  It very well may be benign but nows the time to act to make sure you have the best outcome.   A second opinion never hurts.

question: Hello, I am a 46 year old male with sarcoidosis, diabetes, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension.  My sarcoidosis has been in check now for about 6 months and I no longer take prednisone.  I have known involvement with sarcoid in my lungs, lyphatic system, and skin.  Last week I went to the urologist due to my epidydimus on my right testicle being swollen.  The urologist didn't think it was overly enlarged and didn't feel anything out of the "normal" during his examination.  The UA was negative.  As a precaution he sent me for an ultrasound.  This week upon returning, he told me the ultrasound showed a bb-sized mass within the right testicle.  He didn't send me for any bloodwork and just wants me to monitor the situation by self examination over the next few months.  He wants me to have another ultrasound in three months for comparison.  Is this the right course of action here?  It seems a little "laid back" considering what could be wrong.  Should I get a second opinion?  Any ideas would be helpful.  Thank you.
title: BB-Sized Mass In Right Testicle
